Package utility

Class Validator

java.lang.Object
utility.Validator
public abstract class Validator extends Object
The Validator class is used to validate text fields against MySQL data types. Checks for the following: VARCHAR(50), VARCHAR(100), INT(10), Email, Phone, and Postal Code.

  • Method Details

    • isVarcharFifty

      public static boolean isVarcharFifty(String fieldName, String validate)
      Checks if input is between 1 and 50 characters. Warns the user if it does not.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to be validated. Used in the error message.
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isVarcharHundred

      public static boolean isVarcharHundred(String fieldName, String validate)
      Checks if input is between 1 and 100 characters. Warns the user if it does not.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to be validated. Used in the error message.
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isName

      public static boolean isName(String validate)
      Checks if input is a name consisting of at least 2 characters separated by a space.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isAddress

      public static boolean isAddress(String validate)
      Validates addresses that are in a similar format to the following addresses: 123 ABC Street, CityName for US and Canadian addresses. 123 ABC Street, BoroughName, CityName for UK addresses.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isIntTen

      public static boolean isIntTen(String fieldName, String validate)
      Checks if input contains 1 - 10 numbers. Warns the user if the input is not valid.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to be validated. Used in the error message.
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isEmail

      public static boolean isEmail(String validate)
      Validates email addresses using RFC 5322 and checks that it is between 3 and 50 characters in length. Warns the user if the input is not valid.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isPhone

      public static boolean isPhone(String validate)
      Validates phone numbers. Phone numbers may be stored in a VARCHAR(50) datatype. Checks if phone numbers are formatted correctly for US and international numbers.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isPostalCode

      public static boolean isPostalCode(String validate)
      Validates postal codes for US, UK, and CA. Uses regex from http://unicode.org/Public/cldr/26.0.1/.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isUserId

      public static boolean isUserId(int validate)
      Validates input against a list of User's and their User_ID's.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isCustomerId

      public static boolean isCustomerId(int validate)
      Validates input against a list of Customers' and their Customer_ID's.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isInt

      public static boolean isInt(String validate)
      Checks if the input is an integer.
      Parameters:
      validate - The String value to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the input is validated, false if it is not.

    • isDateAvailable

      public static boolean isDateAvailable(ZonedDateTime start, ZonedDateTime end, int id) throws AppointmentOverlapException
      Checks to see if the time and date is available for an appointment.
      Parameters:
      start - The start date
      end - The end date
      id - The Appointment_ID to prevent it from being compared against itself.
      Returns:
      true if the date is available to book.
      Throws:
      AppointmentOverlapException - if overlap is detected.

    • isTimeValid

      public static boolean isTimeValid(ZonedDateTime startTime, ZonedDateTime endTime, LocalTime startEST, LocalTime endEST)
      Checks if the start date and time is before the end date and time.
      Parameters:
      startTime - The date and time the appointment starts.
      endTime - the date and time the appointment ends.
      Returns:
      true if the times are validated, false if they are not validated.

    • isBetween

      public static boolean isBetween(ZonedDateTime start, ZonedDateTime end, ZonedDateTime start2, ZonedDateTime end2)
      Checks if the start and end dates are between another set of start and end dates.
      Parameters:
      start - Start date to be added.
      end - End date to be added.
      start2 - Start date to be compared.
      end2 - End date to be compared.
      Returns:
      true if the dates to be added are between any existing dates.
